title: Atelier de Construction de Puteaux
text:
The Atelier de Construction de Puteaux (APX) (English translation: "Puteaux Construction Workshops") was a state <a href="arsenal">arsenal</a> belonging to the <a href="French%20Army">French Army</a>. It was located at 8, quai national in <a href="Puteaux">Puteaux</a>.
History.
Atelier de Construction de Puteaux was in charge of making <a href="ammunition">ammunition</a> and carrying out tests. The factories also produced small and medium-sized equipment (<a href="Firearm">firearms</a> and <a href="Knife">knives</a>), while the so-called “manufacturing” workshops produced larger equipment (<a href="Artillery">artillery pieces</a>).
Atelier de Construction de Puteaux disappeared after the <a href="Second%20World%20War">Second World War</a>, being transferred to <a href="Satory">Satory</a> and merged with <a href="Ateliers%20de%20construction%20d%27Issy-les-Moulineaux">Ateliers de construction d'Issy-les-Moulineaux</a> (AMX), which specialized in the construction of <a href="Tank">tanks</a> and other armored vehicles.
Atelier de Construction de Puteaux had two responsibilities:
To design new weapons for the <a href="French%20Army">French Army</a>. It specialized in <a href="small%20arms">small arms</a> and medium caliber weapons and their accessories: such as <a href="machine%20gun">machine gun</a>s, cannon, <a href="Gun%20turret%23Combat%20vehicles">tank turrets</a>, <a href="Telescopic%20sight">Telescopic sight</a>s for rifles, <a href="missile">missile</a>s etc.
And for serial production of those weapons, alone or concurrently with other factories.
